message_1: Suppose a message "MATHEMATICS" is encrypted using a Vigenere cipher with the keyword "CODE". What is the encrypted message?
message_2:
To encrypt the message "MATHEMATICS" using a Vigenere cipher with the keyword "CODE", we first need to repeat the keyword to match the length of the message:

MATHEMATICS
CODECODECOD

Now, we use the Vigenere cipher table to find the encrypted letters. For example, for the first letter, we find the intersection of the row M and the column C, which is Q. We do this for each letter:

M -> Q (row M, column C)
A -> C (row A, column O)
T -> Z (row T, column D)
H -> G (row H, column E)
E -> E (row E, column C)
M -> Q (row M, column O)
A -> C (row A, column D)
T -> Z (row T, column E)
I -> I (row I, column C)
C -> O (row C, column O)
S -> S (row S, column D)

The encrypted message is "QCZGEQZCIOS".
